alert.note: Alert for Howell; Ozark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 4:40PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Howell. In southwest Missouri, Ozark. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 440 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Little North Fork River at County Road 916, Bennetts River at Highway 142, Possum Walk Creek at Highway T, Lick Creek at County Road 528, Little North Fork at Haskins Ford Road, Spring Creek at County Road 349 and Pond Fork at County Road 883. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gainesville, Bakersfield, Theodosia, Pontiac, Sundown, Hardenville, Tecumseh, Zanoni, Udall, Sycamore, Isabella, Caulfield, Thornfield, Long Run, Moody, Norfork Lake and Bull Shoals Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
